members.member:
\addtogroup return_values Return Values \brief List of possible return values of BabyLINDLL functions
The following values may be returned by BLC_ and BLC_ functions to indicate the success or failure of an operation. Mostly, the functions will return BLC_OK as an indicator for success. However, some functions use positive values to return the result of the function on success ( for example BLC_getFrameCount will return the number of frames )
Function successfully completed.

member.summary: Limit for separating BabyLIN- and PC-side errors; below there are all PC-side ones.

member.summary: Internal resource allocation problem. Maybe out of memory/handles/etc.

member.summary: Specified handle invalid.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_NO_CONNECTION
member.summary: There is no connection open.

member.summary: Serial port couldn't be opened or closed.

member.summary: BabyLIN command syntax error.

member.summary: BabyLIN doesn't answer within timeout.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_FILE_ERROR
member.summary: Unable to open a file.

member.summary: Wrong parameter given to function.

member.summary: Internal message format error.

member.summary: The given signal_nr or name does not exist in loaded SDF.

member.summary: The signal chosen is a scalar, but an array function was called.

member.summary: A sendCommand message timed out

member.summary: SDF can not be loaded to a the device due to incompatibibility ( incompatible SDFV3 to SDFV2 device )

member.summary: A download is already in progress

member.summary: the one of the parameters is invalid. like a null pointer in a @ref BLC_getUnsignedNumber.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_NO_GETTER_DEFINED
member.summary: the property has no getter for that type e.g. a unsigned number can not be read from a Binary property.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_NO_SETTER_DEFINED
member.summary: the property has no setter for that type e.g. a callback can not be stored into Binary property.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SET_VALUE_REJECTED

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_NOT_RESOLVABLE_TAG_FIRST
member.summary: A return value between BLC_UA_NOT_RESOLVABLE_TAG_FIRST and BLC_UA_NOT_RESOLVABLE_TAG_MAX indicates that the path parameter given to one of the BLC_UnifiedAccess functions could not be found. The index of that key is the return value - BLC_UA_NOR_RESOLVABLE_TAG_FIRST .

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_NOT_RESOLVABLE_TAG_MAX
member.summary: The given Path should not have more then 100 tags

member.summary: The ua_service_iso_tp, is supposed to send a request but has no request data.

member.summary: During the reception of the Response or the Request an invalid series of consecutive frames were detected.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SERVICE_TIMEOUT_SEND
member.summary: A Frame send by the DLL was not echoed by the BabyLIN within timeout_frame milliseconds. You might have to do a disframe/mon_on with that FrameID.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SERVICE_TIMEOUT_RESPONSE
member.summary: The Response was not received within timeout_response milliseconds. Maybe the Request is malformed?

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SERVICE_TIMEOUT_FLOWCONTROL_SEND
member.summary: A flow-control Frame send by the DLL was not echoed by the BabyLIN within timeout_frame milliseconds. You might have to do a disframe/mon_on with that FrameID.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SERVICE_FLOWCONTROL_INVALIDSTATE
member.summary: The flow-control state reported by the target is not one of the known states.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SERVICE_FLOWCONTROL_WAITSTATES
member.summary: The flow-control state was "wait"(0x1) in more then max_flow_wait flow-control frames.

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_SERVICE_FLOWCONTROL_OVERFLOW
member.summary: The flow-control state was "overflow"(0x2).

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_REQUESTED_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_FIRST
member.summary: A return value between BLC_UA_REQUESTED_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_FIRST and BLC_UA_REQUESTED_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_MAX indicates that the path parameter given to one of the BLC_UnifiedAccess functions could not be resolved. The index of the object, that could not be found is the return value - BLC_UA_REQUESTED_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_FIRST (this index is 0 based).

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_UA_REQUESTED_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND_MAX
member.summary: The given Path should not have more then 100 objects

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_registerFrameCallback(System.IntPtr,de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.CallBackFrameDelegate)
member.summary:
Registers a callback function, which is called on every reception of a (monitored) frame.
Issuing a NULL-pointer de-registers the callback function. As the function is called from another thread context, take care of thread-safety (i.e. using mutexes, etc.).
member.param: Handle representing the channel id which the frame occurred
Pointer to a function call-compatible to CallBackFrameDelegate.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

Use BabyLin.ConvertObjectToIntPtr() and BabyLin.ConvertIntPtrToObject() to en- and decode objects into IntPtr.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_registerDTLResponseCallback(System.IntPtr,de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.CallBackDTLDelegate)
member.summary: Registers a callback function, which is called on every reception of a DTL response, but only if BabyLIN emulates the master node. Issuing a NULL-pointer de-registers the callback function. As the function is called from another thread context, take care of thread-safety (i.e. using mutexes, etc.).
member.param: Handle representing the connection; returned previously by BL_open().
Reference to a function call-compatible to CallBackDTLDelegate.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BL_getLastError().

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_getBabyLinPorts(de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_portInfo_t[],System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Retrieve a list of ports a BabyLIN is connected to.
The function doesn't try to connect to the found Ports wraps BLC_getBabyLinPortsTimout with timout value set to 1000ms
member.param: array to be filled
the length of the array to be filled
member.returns: the number of connected BabyLINs found (>=0) or < 0 on error

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_getBabyLinPortsTimout(de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_portInfo_t[],System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Retrieve a list of ports a BabyLIN is connected to.
The function doesn't try to connect to the found Ports. You can not connect to UDP network devices they are only listed FYI and have to be configured in SimpleMenu mode first. Network devices of type TCP will have the default Port configured(2048) for connection. If the Device's simplemenu-tcp-com-port configuration value was changed. you will have to change the BLC_PORTINFO.port prior to connecting via BLC_openPort(...).
member.param: array to be filled
the length of the array to be filled
a timeout value in ms to wait for replies of network devices
member.returns: the number of connected BabyLINs found (>=0) or < 0 on error

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_open(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Open a connection to a BabyLIN USB-Serial device.
This function tries to open the designated port and to start communication with the device.
member.param: the port, the BabyLIN is connected to. It uses Windows-style numbering, which means it starts with '1' for the first serial port. '0' is reserved. On linux systems, the port is represented by the path to the device file ("/dev/ttyUSB0" f.ex.)
member.returns: Returns an handle for the BabyLIN-connection or NULL if the connection could not be established. You may fetch the corresponding (textual) error with BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_openNet(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Open a connection to a BabyLIN device using ethernet.
This function tries to open the designated ip and port and to start communication with the device.
member.param: the ip-address of the BabyLIN to connect to
the ip-port of the BabyLIN toconnected to
member.returns: Returns an handle for the BabyLIN-connection or NULL if the connection could not be established. you may fetch the corresponding (textual) error with BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_openUSB(System.String)
member.summary:
Open a connection to a BabyLIN USB device.
This function tries to open the designated port and to start communication with the device.
member.param: the usb device string, the BabyLIN is connected to.
member.returns: Returns an handle for the BabyLIN-connection or NULL if the connection could not be established. You may fetch the corresponding (textual) error with BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_openPort(de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_portInfo_t)
member.summary:
Open a connection to a BabyLIN device using BLC_PORTINFO information.
This function tries to open the BabyLIN device of the BLC_PORTINFO information, i.e. works as a wrapper for BLC_open and BLC_openNet which automatically decides which connection to establish.
latform independent way of connecting to BabyLIN-devices found by BLC_getBabyLinPorts or BLC_getBabyLinPortsTimout
member.param: the BLC_PORTINFO-structure of the BabyLIN to connect to ( see BLC_getBabyLinPorts )
member.returns: Returns an handle for the BabyLIN-connection or NULL if the connection could not be established. You may fetch the corresponding (textual) error with BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_convertUrl(System.String,de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_portInfo_t@)
member.summary:
Convert a device url to BLC_PORTINFO to use in BLC_openPort
this function tries to convert a given url to a complete struct of type BLC_portInfo_t.
member.param: the device url to convert might be a system path (serial:///dev/ttyUSB1) for unix based systems, a comport (serial://COM1) as is used for windows or a network addess (tcp://127.0.0.1:2048) to connect to a network device.
the port info (in case of error, the BLC_portInfo_t structure is left untouched)
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_loadSDF(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Loads the specified SDF-file into library and optionally the BabyLIN device.
The SDF is generated by LINWorks/SessionConf from a LDF file. Warning: this resets the device upon download
member.param: Handle representing the connection. (see BLC_open )
C-string with the (fully qualified) filename (i.e. "mybus.sdf", if in the same directory, or "c:/data/mybus.sdf").
boolean value, determines if the SDF profile gets downloaded into the BabyLIN device (!=0) or only used in the library (=0).
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_loadLDF(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Loads the specified LDFile into library and optionally the BabyLIN device.
Loads a given LDF, converts the LDF to a SDF ( without SDF specific features ) and optionally downloads the generated SDF to the device Warning: this resets the device upon download
member.param: Handle representing the connection. (see BLC_open )
C-string with the (fully qualified) filename (i.e. "mybus.ldf", if in the same directory, or "c:/data/mybus.ldf").
boolean value, determines if the generated SDF profile gets downloaded into the BabyLIN device (!=0) or only used in the library (=0).
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_downloadSDF(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Loads the previously loaded SDF-file into the BabyLIN device.
The SDF could be generated by LINWorks/SessionConf from a LDF file and must have been loaded previously by an BL_loadSDF() command. Warning: this resets the device!
member.param: Handle representing the connection. (see BLC_open )
If mode is '=2' the Download is only performed if the CRC is different from what is currently loaded into the device.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.summary: Starts direct mode on channel with given baudrate, bitwidth, stopbits and parity settings. If the direct mode is already active on the channel, it will be restarted. The command prepares the channel with @ref BLC_dmReportConfig settings of 5ms and 8 bytes
member.param: Handle representing the channel to which the frame belongs
the baudrate to configure while in direct mode.
this parameter is not yet used and has to be set to 0. The bitwidth will be 8.
this parameter is not yet used and has to be set to 0. It will be 1 stopbit.
this parameter is not yet used and has to be set to 0. Parity bit is deactivated.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_dmReportConfig(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
configure the reporting policy of the device
in respect to a timeout and/or a block of bytes. The device will report any data read from the bus if the read data exceeds the given byte count or after [timeout] milliseconds idle time.
direct mode has to be active
member.param: Handle representing the channel to which the frame belongs
the time in milliseconds until the bus is determined as idle resulting in a report of data even thou less then [bytes] data was received.
the amount of data after wich a report is generated.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation BLC_getLastError.

if no bus power is available, the data will be queued to be sent when bus power is available

the buffer containing the data to send.
the amount of data in the buffer.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_setDTLMode(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the Diagnostic Transport Layer mode.
There are different Diagnostic modes, which offer different levels of protocol functionality. The Baby-LIN will start with Diagnostic OFF on Power Up. If the BabyLIN acts as LIN master then the selection of an Diagnostic Mode happens trough the usage of the appropriate API function calls. So the API functions BL_sendRawMasterRequest or BL_sendRawSlaveResponse will start the Diagnostic RAW mode, where as the API calls BL_sendDTLRequest or BL_sendDTLResponse will start the Diagnostic DTL mode. If the BabyLIN acts as LIN slave then the DTL mode must be set by use of this function. It is not possible to use different Diagnostics modes at the same time !
List of DTL modes: | Mode | Name | Description | |-----:|:-----|:------------| |0 | DTL_NONE | no DTL Support | |1 | DTL_RAW | RAW Mode DTL Support | |2 | DTL_COOKED | Cooked Mode DTL Support |
member.param: Handle representing a LIN-channel (see BLC_getChannelHandle )
DTL mode: 0 = DTL_NONE = no DTL Support 1 = DTL_RAW = RAW Mode DTL Support 2 = DTL_COOKED = Cooked Mode DTL Support
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_sendRawSlaveResponse(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Send a (non-DTL) SlaveResp upon receive of matching MasterReq.
Upon the reveive of the next MasterReq frame, every bit of the request is compared to 'reqdata' if the corresponding bit of 'reqmask' is set (1). If all match, Baby-LIN starts to send out the data given in 'data', 8 bytes with each SlaveResp frame.
member.param: Handle representing a LIN-channel (see BLC_getChannelHandle )
Data of the expected MasterReq (exactly 8 bytes).
Mask for 'reqdata' to indicate which bits must match (exactly 8 bytes).
MasterReq frame data (multiple of 8 bytes).
Length of data to send.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_sendRawMasterRequest(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Send a (non-DTL) MasterReq with the specified 8 bytes as data.
The internal raw-SlaveResponse-buffer is being reset and the Baby-LIN device gets instructed to report the next 'count' SlaveResp-frames which in turn are accumulated into the SlaveResponse-buffer which can be queried by BL_getRawSlaveResponse().
member.param: Handle representing a LIN-channel (see BLC_getChannelHandle )
MasterReq frame data (exactly 8 bytes).
Number of expected SlaveResp frames.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_getAnswerTypeByName(System.IntPtr,System.String,de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_ANSWER_TYPE@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary:
Get type of a parameter of the last answer data from a BabyLIN
If the last answer to a command contained additional data, then this function reports the type and size for a specific answer data set. Data set selected by name. The following types of data sets are possible: BLC_ANSWER_TYPE_INT - 32bit integer, BLC_ANSWER_TYPE_STR - zero-terminated string (variable length), BLC_ANSWER_TYPE_BIN - binary data (variable length)
member.param: Handle representing the channel on which the answer data was received (see BLC_getChannelHandle )
char*-string with the name of answer data set
type of data set is returned within: BLC_ANSWER_TYPE_INT - 32bit integer, BLC_ANSWER_TYPE_STR - zero-terminated string (variable length), BLC_ANSWER_TYPE_BIN - binary data (variable length)
length of data set is returned within
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_encodeSignal(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Encodes the signal's value as defined in the corresponding Signal Encoding tables of LDF/SDF.
If no SignalEncoding is specified for this signal, the value itself is written into destination buffer 'description'. If one of the required pointers is NULL or the buffer size is too small, the function returns the needed minimum buffer length in 'length'. It's possible to use two variants to get encoded signal: 1) pointer 'encUnit' and 'buffLen1' set to NULL: then encoded signal saved inclusive unit in buffer 'encSignal' 2) pointer 'encUnit' and 'buffLen1' != NULL: unit of signal saved separately in buffer 'encUnit'
member.param: Handle representing the channel to which the signal belongs (see BLC_getChannelHandle )
Number (Index) of the signal accordng to SDF.
Value to be encoded
points to save location of encoded signal value (inclusive 'unit', if 'encUnit' not used)
optional: points to save location of signal unit (if this pointer is NULL then 'unit' saved in 'encSignal' buffer also)
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_decodeSignal(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.String,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: BLC_decodeSignal takes an encoded Signal value and tries to compute it back to its Signal value. Rounding errors might occur for large signals or encoding scales and offsets.
member.param: the Channel handle the Signal does come from.
the number of the Signal that has the encodings.
the encoded signal value as a string.
the reverted value. rounding errors might occur.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_createHandle(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: BLC_createHandle retrieves a handle to a loaded Object or creates a new Object. These Objects can range from Devices and SDFs down to Signals. When retrieving a handle to an existing item the path has to end with a key value pair, where the key is a tag of the objects children list. When creating a new Object the "new_*=*" key value pair can be followed by key value pairs from the new objects property list, to initialize them.
member.param: the handle to start the query from.
the query, it is a cstring build from key value pairs, separated by spaces e.g. "protocol=1 service=2".
value to store the new handle in.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_destroy(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: BLC_destroy removes the handle from the currently opened Objects and removes the Object from its parent. The given handle will be removed from the available handles and the Object behind it will be destroyed.
member.param: the handle of the object to destroy.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_releaseHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: BLC_releaseHandle removes the handle from the currently opened Objects. The given handle will be release, but a new handle to the underling object can be retrieved again.
member.param: the handle to release.
member.returns: Status of operation; '=0' means successful, '!=0' otherwise. See standard return values for error, or for textual representation (for return values < -1000) BLC_getLastError.

the result string.

member.name: M:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_execute_async(System.IntPtr,System.String,de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.CallBackUserDataUnifiedAccessAsyncDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: BLC_execute_async a method of the given handle. The path will be followed and a tag that identifies a Method property, followed by the tags to set additional parameters of that method. The Method will be executed in a non blocking manner, so the returned value does not state anything about whether the operation was successful, or not, but only if it was found or not. To get the result value you would get from BLC_execute use the first parameter of the CallBackUserDataUnifiedAccessAsyncDelegate.
member.param: the handle to start the query from.
the query, it is a cstring build from entries of tags.
the callback to call once the operation is complete.
the additional parameter to call the callback with.

member.name: T:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_error_t
member.summary: Represents a LIN error message

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_error_t.timestamp
member.summary: Time of occurence. The timestamp when the error occurred. device-timstamp in us if error type is a device error (1-13) pc timestamp in ms if error type is dll error (65535)

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_error_t.type
member.summary:
Error type
| Value | Name | Description | Status | |------:|:-----|:------------|:-------| |1|ERRTYPE_ID|Parity error in ID| | |2|ERRTYPE_DATA|Read data from BUS does not match send data| Frame-ID | |3|ERRTYPE_FRAMING|Framing error in data reception|Frame-ID| |4|ERRTYPE_CHECKSUM|Checksum failed|Frame-ID| |5|ERRTYPE_DATATO|Data timed out (incomplete msg reception)|Frame-ID| |6|ERRTYPE_SEQ|Unexpected state sequencing|internal status| |8|ERRTYPE_MACRO|Error in macro execution|internal status| |9|ERRTYPE_BUSBUSY|Bus is already used|internal status| |10|ERRTYPE_BUSOFF|Bus is offline (no bus power) |internal status| |11|ERRTYPE_BUSSPEED_DIFFERS|Actual bus-speed differs from LDF bus speed (Warning) |actual speed| |12|ERRTYPE_KWP_ERROR|Error in KWP|KWP error code| |13|ERRTYPE_APPLICATION|Application error|unused| |14|ERRTYPE_RESP_LOST|Response send buffer overflow occured|unused| |15|ERRTYPE_CAN_NOERR|CAN error disappeared|unused| |16|ERRTYPE_CAN|CAN error| bitmap 0x01 noAck 
 bitmap 0x02 stuffing error 
 bitmap 0x04 framing error 
 bitmap 0x08 recessive bit error 
 bitmap 0x10 dominant bit error 
 bitmap 0x20 checksum error| |65535|ERRTYPE_DLL_ERROR|Error in DLL occurred|dll status code|

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_error_t.status
member.summary:
Additional error information
Depends on type descriptions. for "dll status code": |status|description| |-----:|:----------| |1|Lost connection to device|

member.summary: Timestamp with pc time, used to calculate age of framedata, to allow timeout functions (ms)

member.summary: FrameID of Frame ( as appeared on the BUS. On LIN BUS without parity bits )

member.summary: Length of frameData

member.summary: Databytes of the frame

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_jumboframe_t.frameFlags
member.summary:
Additional, informational frame flags
Used as a bitfield, multiple flags possible | Value | Description | |------:|:------------| | 0x01 | Frame has error | | 0x02 | Frame is selfsent (sent by the BabyLIN-Device, because it simulates the corresponding node) | | 0x04 | Timebase, if set, the unit of timestamp is ms, otherwise us | | 0x08 | The frame was a SDF specified frame | | 0x10 | The frame was an injected frame | | 0x20 | The frame was a protocol frame |

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_jumboframe_t.busFlags
member.summary:
Bus specific flags
for LIN-BUS: Used as a bitfield, multiple flags possible | Value | Description | |------:|:------------| | 0x01 |Valid CLASSIC checksum (V1)| | 0x02 |Valid EXTENDED checksum (V2)| | 0x04 |incomplete frame without checksum, not an error| | 0x08 |Errorframe (f.ex: no data)| | 0x10 |Frame is slaveresponse to a master request. If set, the upper 3 bits of flags denote a master request id| | 0x20 |Event triggered frame ( only if 0x10 is not set )|
for CAN-BUS: Used as a bitfields, multiple flags possible | Value | Description | |------:|:------------| | 0x01 | 29 bit frame identifier |

member.name: F:de.lipowsky.BLC.BabyLin.BLC_jumboframe_t.checksum
member.summary: checksum of the frame stores a checksum V1 or V2 ( refer to busFlags which checksum type applies )
